episodeTitle: The Last Counterattack by the Memory Thief Who Reveals His True Colors!
episodeTitleJapanese: 本性を現した記憶泥棒の最後の逆襲！
episodeTitleRomanized: Honjō o arawashita kioku dorobō no saigo no gyakushū
description: Luffy battles Zoro while Noko the seahorse unleashes his final desperate attack, creating illusions of past allies and enemies from the Straw Hats' memories. After stealing their complete memories, Noko transforms into what he believes is a Sennenryu. Luffy defeats him and restores all memories, but the crew must escape when villagers mistakenly blame them for the memory theft.

events.title: Luffy Battles Zoro
events.description: Luffy returns to confront Zoro who is still under Noko's hypnotic influence. The two clash in an even battle as Luffy tries to avoid seriously hurting his crewmate while the others search for Noko.
events.significance: Continues the tension from the previous episode with the crew fighting among themselves due to Noko's manipulation. Shows Luffy's restraint in fighting his own friend.

events.title: Noko Creates Memory Illusions
events.description: Cornered by the Straw Hats, Noko reveals his ultimate defensive ability: he exhales a purple smoke cloud that manifests illusions of people from the crew's stolen memories. These illusions include past allies and enemies, designed to distract and emotionally manipulate the crew.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Noko's memory-based powers. The illusions force the crew to confront memories of their past, adding emotional weight to the battle.

events.title: Illusions of Past Characters Appear
events.description: Among the illusions created from the crew's memories, various characters from their past adventures manifest, including allies like Portgas D. Ace and former adversaries. Each crew member is confronted with emotionally significant figures from their history.
events.significance: Provides a nostalgic callback to earlier arcs and demonstrates the depth of memories Noko has stolen. The appearance of these illusions shows how intertwined the crew's memories have become with their shared experiences.

events.title: Noko Steals All Remaining Memories
events.description: Using his ultimate technique, Noko releases a blue-white wave that paralyzes the entire crew and drains all of their remaining memories completely. The Straw Hats lose all recollection of their identities, their bonds, and their purpose.
events.significance: The climax of Noko's plan and the lowest point for the crew in this arc. This represents the complete loss of identity and demonstrates the true danger of Noko's memory-stealing abilities.

events.title: Noko's Sennenryu Transformation
events.description: After absorbing all the Straw Hats' memories, Noko's body inflates dramatically and begins to float in the air. He proudly declares that he has finally achieved his dream of becoming a Sennenryu (Millennial Dragon), believing that being large and airborne makes him a dragon.
events.significance: Reveals Noko's true motivation throughout the arc - his obsession with becoming a dragon. This transformation connects to the earlier Warship Island filler arc featuring actual Sennenryu. Shows the tragic nature of the villain who misunderstands what it truly means to be a dragon.

quotes.speaker: Noko
quotes.context: Noko's declaration as he inflates and floats after absorbing the crew's memories

events.title: Luffy Instinctively Attacks Noko
events.description: Despite having lost all his memories, Luffy's body moves instinctively. He launches himself into the air using his rubber powers and wraps his stretched body around the floating Noko, grappling him mid-flight.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Luffy's will and fighting instinct transcend memory. Even without conscious thought, his body remembers how to fight and protect his crew. This is a key theme about the power of bonds going beyond conscious memory.

events.title: Luffy's Memories Restored
events.description: As Luffy squeezes Noko in pain, the seahorse involuntarily releases Luffy's memories back to him. For the second time in the arc, Luffy regains his full memory and immediately understands the situation. His eyes show recognition and determination.
events.significance: The turning point of the episode. Luffy regaining his memories while in combat position allows him to deliver the finishing blow. Shows that Noko's control over stolen memories is not absolute when under physical duress.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Noko
events.description: With his memories restored, Luffy delivers a powerful blow to Noko, defeating the memory thief decisively. The impact forces Noko to release all the stolen memories he had accumulated, sending them back to their rightful owners across the island.
events.significance: The resolution of the Ocean's Dream Arc's main conflict. Noko's defeat ends the memory crisis and restores everyone's identities. This marks the conclusion of the seahorse's misguided quest to become a dragon.

events.title: All Memories Restored
events.description: As Noko is defeated and sent flying through the air, he releases all the stolen memories like a burst of light spreading across the island. The Straw Hat crew and all the villagers of Ruluka simultaneously regain their complete memories.
events.significance: The happy resolution that restores everyone's identities and relationships. All the stolen memories return to their owners, ending the crisis that began five episodes ago.

events.title: Zoro's Memory Restored
events.description: Zoro regains his memory and is freed from Noko's hypnotic control. He reveals that his memory actually returned when Noko coughed up his memory earlier, and he had been waiting for the right moment to act.
events.significance: Reveals that Zoro had regained his senses earlier than apparent, showing his tactical thinking. Also explains the resolution of his conflict with Luffy.

events.title: Drim Freed from Hypnosis
events.description: With Noko defeated, Drim is released from the seahorse's hypnotic control. The young boy has no memory of his actions while under Noko's influence and is confused about what happened.
events.significance: Reveals that Drim was an innocent victim manipulated by Noko all along. This absolves him of responsibility for the memory thefts and sets up the bittersweet conclusion of the arc.

events.title: Drim Reunites with His Mother
events.description: Freed from Noko's control, Drim is able to return to his mother on Ruluka Island. The two have an emotional reunion, with Drim no longer burdened by the seahorse's manipulation.
events.significance: Provides a happy ending for Drim's storyline. Shows that innocent people caught up in Noko's schemes can return to their normal lives once freed from his influence.

events.title: Villagers Mistakenly Attack the Straw Hats
events.description: Despite the crew defeating Noko and restoring everyone's memories, the villagers of Ruluka Island mistake the Straw Hat Pirates for the memory thieves. Drim's warning to the villagers, given before fully understanding the situation, leads to the entire village attacking the crew.
events.significance: Creates an ironic and bittersweet ending to the arc. The crew saves everyone but receives no gratitude, reinforcing the theme of pirates being misunderstood. This is a common One Piece motif where the crew's good deeds go unrecognized.

events.title: The Straw Hats Escape Ruluka Island
events.description: Faced with an angry mob of villagers, the Straw Hat Pirates are forced to make a hasty retreat. They escape the island empty-handed using the Waver, leaving behind the confusion and misunderstanding.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Ocean's Dream Arc with the crew departing Ruluka Island. Despite saving everyone, they leave with nothing to show for it - a humorous and slightly melancholic conclusion typical of filler arcs.

themes.description: The episode explores how memories define who we are. When the crew loses all their memories, they lose their identities. Yet Luffy's instinctive actions show that bonds and experiences transcend conscious memory.
themes.symbolism: The stolen memories being returned as bursts of light symbolizes the restoration of identity and self. Noko's inflation represents a false transformation - appearing to be something without truly becoming it.

themes.description: Even without memories, Luffy's body moves instinctively to protect his crew and fight. This suggests that some bonds and fighting spirit exist at a level deeper than conscious thought.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's body wrapping around Noko despite having no conscious memory represents the idea that true strength and loyalty are ingrained at an instinctive level.

themes.description: Despite saving the island and restoring everyone's memories, the Straw Hats are blamed and attacked. This reinforces the recurring theme that pirates are automatically seen as villains, regardless of their actions.
themes.symbolism: The crew's empty-handed escape represents the thankless nature of their heroism - they do good for its own sake, not for recognition or reward.

themes.description: Noko's belief that inflating and floating makes him a dragon represents the idea of false transformation - appearing to change without true change. This contrasts with genuine character growth.
themes.symbolism: Noko's inflated form is hollow and temporary, unlike true growth which is solid and lasting.
culturalReferences: References the Warship Island arc's Sennenryu (Millennial Dragons), connecting to earlier One Piece lore about mythical dragon creatures

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ocean's Dream Arc, including this episode, is anime-only filler not present in the manga. It was created based on the PlayStation video game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream'.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the conclusion of the Ocean's Dream Arc, which spanned episodes 220-224. The arc was based on the PlayStation video game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream' released in 2003.

sources.title: Ocean's Dream Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Noko's obsession with becoming a Sennenryu (Millennial Dragon) directly references the earlier Warship Island filler arc (episodes 54-61) which featured actual Sennenryu creatures.
Episode 224 received a 6.7/10 rating on IMDb, reflecting mixed reception typical of One Piece filler episodes.

This episode aired on March 6, 2005 in Japan, during a period when the anime was producing filler content to allow the manga to progress further ahead. The Ocean's Dream arc served as a buffer before the Water 7 arc began.
The illusions created by Noko included characters from the crew's past adventures, with Portgas D. Ace notably appearing among them, providing a callback to earlier emotional moments in the series.
The episode's English dub used 'Eternal Pose' as the ending song instead of 'Mirai Kōkai' due to music licensing issues with FUNimation's release.
